Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness, Misuse of rejected evidence in credibility assessment
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed risk due to military draft evasion
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review, redetermination of PRRA application
Court_Ruling: Judicial review allowed, decision found unreasonable
Defendant_Behavior: Officer used previously rejected evidence to discredit new evidence without justification
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of persecution due to military draft evasion
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide oral hearing when credibility was indirectly questioned
Credibility_Assessment: Not directly questioned, but implied through use of prior rejection
Evidence_Used: Evidence of draft evasion, previously rejected claims
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections related to PRRA and new evidence under IRPA
Application_Basis: Fear of risk upon removal due to military service avoidance
Evidence_Assessed: New evidence regarding personal risk from military draft
Governing_Rule: Only new evidence can be submitted post-rejection; oral hearing required if credibility is seriously in question
Outcome: Decision set aside, case remitted for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of forced military service or punishment upon return
Cause_Description: Applicant's PRRA application denied; judicial review sought due to procedural unfairness and improper evidence handling
Evidence_Handling: Improper: rejected evidence used to undermine new submission
Evidence_Issues: Use of previously rejected evidence to discredit new application
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act - PRRA provisions
Decision_Rationale: Officer concluded insufficient evidence without properly considering new submissions
Evidentiary_Issues: Reliance on past rejection to discredit current claim without proper analysis
